sub_topic: The Poincaré map and its use in studying chaotic systems
message_1:
Consider a chaotic system with a Poincaré map given by: x[n+1] = 2x[n] - floor(2x[n]), where x[n] represents the state of the system at time step n, and floor(.) is the greatest integer less than or equal to the argument. 

If the initial state of the system is x[0] = 0.1, what is the value of x[10] according to the Poincaré map?
